Sir, I have to inform you that Mr. S.T. Robson, a director of Messrs. Head, Wrightson & Co. Ltd. and the Chairman of the Council of British Manufacturers of Petroleum Equipment will be visiting the Middle East during October - December with a view m£ to investigating the possibilities of the sale of United Kingdom equipment in this area. The tour is being made at the invitation of the British companies operating in these territories. 2. Mr. Robson has been advised to call upon you on his arrival in Bahrain, and you will no doubt afford him all the usual and proper assistance. A copy of his itinerary is enclosed for your information. 3. I am to add that the Council of British Manufacturers of Petroleum Equipment, which has nearly 250 member firms, was formed some six years ago to foster the interests of United Kingdom manufacturers of petroleum equipment. titleInfo.title: 'File 9/39 Council of British Manufacturers of Petroleum Equipment'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers in the file are arranged chronologically. There are file notes at the end, on folio 7. The notes are arranged chronologically and refer to documents within the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 8; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 2-5; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and are located in the same position as the main sequence.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence sent and received by the Political Agent at Bahrain concerning the visit of the Director and the Chairman of the Council of British Manufacturers of Petroleum Equipment to the Persian Gulf, to investigate the possibility of the sale of equipment in the area.
